content: webster street knittery by jennifer peck lily s scrap blanket lily s scrap blanket is more of a recipe or formula for creating a chevron striped blanket than a rigid pattern it is an excellent way to use leftover yarn of similar weight to create a colorful cozy baby blanket couch throw or other warm home accessory an i-cord edge provides a smooth and structured border while the chevron stripes give it a playful and visually interesting look this recipe is easily customizable for different yarn weights and to create a finished piece of whatever size you choose © 2017 jennifer peck all rights reserved pattern for personal use only questions contact websterstreetknittery@gmail com details & materials this project you may do something similar or you may join your yarn as you go i would recommend size one size easily customizable using a joining method that does not leave ends to be woven in measurements approximately 36 long by 36 wide after blocking monster yarn cakes are large wound cakes of yarn composed of numerous smaller amounts of yarn sock/fingering weight yarn different yarns they tend to work better with approximately 300 grams total thinner weight yarns needles suggested 3 75 mm us 5 circular needles at least 32 long and two double pointed needles of the same size notions optional removable stitch marker gauge gauge is not vital for this pattern choose a yarn and needle combination that creates a fabric that you like keeping in mind that this may result in different yardage requirements and finished product measurements pattern notes this pattern is easily customizable to make a blanket from any weight yarn and in a size to your liking remember to change your needle size accordingly to the yarn weight you choose the chevron pattern has a 20 stitch repeat and measures approximately 3 wide after blocking in to make a monster yarn cake gather the yarns sock weight yarn simply multiple 20 by the you wish to incorporate into your project this is a number of repeats you wish to have then add 6 great opportunity to use up leftovers from other stitches for the i-cord edges projects the sample shown has a repeat of 12 chevrons arrange the yarns in the order you wish to knit them larger skeins/balls can be broken up into smaller amounts to spread the color throughout your blanket start winding your first yarn if your monster yarn cakes yarns are already in balls or cakes you can wind directly onto the winder skeins can be put onto a the sample shown is made with a mix of different swift then wound sock yarns in 2 and 4 ply construction prior to beginning varying amounts from approximately wind your yarn until you have a few feet left 9 to 30 grams of yarn were joined together and using any joining method you like i
